creator: bimargulies@gmail.com
text: If I search Google for "tomcat StandardContext" I get the 5.5 doc at the top, and none of the other versions. It would be good if newer versions also showed up.
Feel free to suggest some patches.
creator: markt@apache.org
bimargulies@gmail.com
text: I wish that I had a clue as to why google is so ignorant of the more recent doc. I wonder whom we could rustle up who would know?

Here's what I've done in the httpd 1.3 documentation:

 <link rel="canonical" href="http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/"/> 

That appears at the top of each page in the 1.3 docs, pointing to the canonical URL for that particular page. This has been extremely effective.
creator: rbowen@apache.org
bimargulies@gmail.com
text: Do you want a patch from me for this, or is there a committer who is willing and able to blow through it?

XML sitemaps are just as effective and less invasive in my experience.
I will conjure something shortly.
creator: bugzilla@pidster.com
bugzilla@pidster.com
text:
Created attachment 27980
Add an XML Sitemap

Modifies files in site/trunk robots.txt, build.xml adds xdocs/sitemap.xml xdocs/sitemap-main.xml.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
sitemap-main.xml has 2 entries with the same loc:

<loc>http://tomcat.apache.org/</loc>

They do have different priorities.

Is that intentional?

creator: bugzilla@pidster.com
text:
Created attachment 27985
Updated patch to add XML sitemap

(In reply to comment #7) 
> Is that intentional?

Nope. More of a wood/trees issue. Thanks.
creator: bugzilla@pidster.com
markt@apache.org
text: The sitemap has been in place for a few days with no sign of improvement in search results.

creator: bugzilla@pidster.com
text:
I've never seen this work immediately, it may take Google some time to resort the results.
The Google Webmaster Tools site will allow an authorised user to monitor sitemap processing.

 http://www.google.com/webmasters/tools/
Two months on and still no change. I think we need to look at Rich's suggestion.
creator: markt@apache.org
markt@apache.org
text: I'm resolvign this as fixed. The search now lists the docs for the three latest Tomact releases as the firts three results.
